trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration enables business partners to access your corporate applications, with each of their users represented by a single Azure AD account
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration enables business partners to access your corporate applications, with each of their users represented by a single Azure AD account

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) B2B collaboration

trans-unit.source: Azure AD B2B collaboration lets you enable access to your corporate applications from partner-managed identities.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD B2B collaboration lets you enable access to your corporate applications from partner-managed identities.

trans-unit.source: You can create cross-company relationships by inviting and authorizing users from partner companies to access your resources.
trans-unit.target: You can create cross-company relationships by inviting and authorizing users from partner companies to access your resources.

trans-unit.source: Complexity is reduced because each company federates once with Azure Active Directory and each user is represented by a single Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: Complexity is reduced because each company federates once with Azure Active Directory and each user is represented by a single Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: Security is increased because access is revoked when partner users are terminated from their organizations, and unintended access via membership in internal directories is prevented.
trans-unit.target: Security is increased because access is revoked when partner users are terminated from their organizations, and unintended access via membership in internal directories is prevented.

trans-unit.source: For business partners who don't already have Azure AD, B2B collaboration has a streamlined sign-up experience to provide Azure AD accounts to your business partners.
trans-unit.target: For business partners who don't already have Azure AD, B2B collaboration has a streamlined sign-up experience to provide Azure AD accounts to your business partners.

trans-unit.source: Your business partners use their own sign-in credentials, which frees you from managing an external partner directory, and from the need to remove access when users leave the partner organization.
trans-unit.target: Your business partners use their own sign-in credentials, which frees you from managing an external partner directory, and from the need to remove access when users leave the partner organization.

trans-unit.source: You manage access to your apps independently of your business partner's account lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: You manage access to your apps independently of your business partner's account lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: This means, for example, that you can revoke access without having to ask the IT department of your business partner to do anything.
trans-unit.target: This means, for example, that you can revoke access without having to ask the IT department of your business partner to do anything.

trans-unit.source: Capabilities
trans-unit.target: Capabilities

trans-unit.source: B2B collaboration simplifies management and improves security of partner access to corporate resources including SaaS apps such as Office 365, Salesforce, Azure Services, and every mobile, cloud and on-premises claims-aware application.
trans-unit.target: B2B collaboration simplifies management and improves security of partner access to corporate resources including SaaS apps such as Office 365, Salesforce, Azure Services, and every mobile, cloud and on-premises claims-aware application.

trans-unit.source: B2B collaboration enables partners manage their own accounts and enterprises can apply security policies to partner access.
trans-unit.target: B2B collaboration enables partners manage their own accounts and enterprises can apply security policies to partner access.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration is easy to configure with simplified sign-up for partners of all sizes even if they don’t have their own Azure Active Directory via an email-verified process.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B collaboration is easy to configure with simplified sign-up for partners of all sizes even if they don’t have their own Azure Active Directory via an email-verified process.

trans-unit.source: It is also easy to maintain with no external directories or per partner federation configurations.
trans-unit.target: It is also easy to maintain with no external directories or per partner federation configurations.

trans-unit.source: The process:
trans-unit.target: The process:

trans-unit.source: Azure AD B2B collaboration allows a company administrator to invite and authorize a set of external users by uploading a comma-separated values (CSV) file of no more than 2000 lines to the B2B collaboration portal.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD B2B collaboration allows a company administrator to invite and authorize a set of external users by uploading a comma-separated values (CSV) file of no more than 2000 lines to the B2B collaboration portal.

trans-unit.source: CSV file upload dialog
trans-unit.target: CSV file upload dialog

trans-unit.source: The portal will send email invitations to these external users.
trans-unit.target: The portal will send email invitations to these external users.

trans-unit.source: The invited user will either sign in to an existing work account with Microsoft (managed in Azure AD), or get a new work account in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The invited user will either sign in to an existing work account with Microsoft (managed in Azure AD), or get a new work account in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Once signed in, the user will be redirected to the app that was shared with them.
trans-unit.target: Once signed in, the user will be redirected to the app that was shared with them.

trans-unit.source: Invitations to consumer email addresses (for example, Gmail or [*comcast.net*](http://comcast.net/)) are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Invitations to consumer email addresses (for example, Gmail or [*comcast.net*](http://comcast.net/)) are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: For more on how B2B collaboration works, check out [this video](http://aka.ms/aadshowb2b).
trans-unit.target: For more on how B2B collaboration works, check out [this video](http://aka.ms/aadshowb2b).

trans-unit.source: CSV File Format
trans-unit.target: CSV File Format

trans-unit.source: The CSV file follows the format below.
trans-unit.target: The CSV file follows the format below.

trans-unit.source: Add all required commas even if you don't specify one or more options.
trans-unit.target: Add all required commas even if you don't specify one or more options.

trans-unit.source: **Email:** Email address for invited user.
trans-unit.target: **Email:** Email address for invited user.

trans-unit.source: **DisplayName:** Display name for invited user (typically, first and last name).
trans-unit.target: **DisplayName:** Display name for invited user (typically, first and last name).

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppID:** The ID for the application to use for branding the email invite and acceptance pages.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppID:** The ID for the application to use for branding the email invite and acceptance pages.

trans-unit.source: **InviteReplyURL:** URL to which to direct an invited user after invite acceptance.
trans-unit.target: **InviteReplyURL:** URL to which to direct an invited user after invite acceptance.

trans-unit.source: This should be a company-specific URL (such as [*contoso.my.salesforce.com*](http://contoso.my.salesforce.com/)).
trans-unit.target: This should be a company-specific URL (such as [*contoso.my.salesforce.com*](http://contoso.my.salesforce.com/)).

trans-unit.source: If this optional field is not specified, the inviting company's Access Panel URL is generated (this URL is of the form `https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/applications/default.aspx?tenantId=<TenantID>`).
trans-unit.target: If this optional field is not specified, the inviting company's Access Panel URL is generated (this URL is of the form `https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/applications/default.aspx?tenantId=<TenantID>`).

trans-unit.source: **InviteAppResources:** AppIDs to which applications can assign users.
trans-unit.target: **InviteAppResources:** AppIDs to which applications can assign users.

trans-unit.source: AppIDs are retrievable by calling `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`
trans-unit.target: AppIDs are retrievable by calling `Get-MsolServicePrincipal | fl DisplayName, AppPrincipalId`

trans-unit.source: **InviteGroupResources:** ObjectIDs for groups to add user to.
trans-unit.target: **InviteGroupResources:** ObjectIDs for groups to add user to.

trans-unit.source: ObjectIDs are retrievable by calling `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId`
trans-unit.target: ObjectIDs are retrievable by calling `Get-MsolGroup | fl DisplayName, ObjectId`

trans-unit.source: **InviteContactUsUrl:** "Contact Us" URL to include in email invitations in case the invited user wants to contact your organization.
trans-unit.target: **InviteContactUsUrl:** "Contact Us" URL to include in email invitations in case the invited user wants to contact your organization.

trans-unit.source: Sample CSV file
trans-unit.target: Sample CSV file

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample CSV you can modify for your purposes.
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample CSV you can modify for your purposes.

trans-unit.source: Save it to any file name you prefer, but ensure that it has a '.csv' file extension.
trans-unit.target: Save it to any file name you prefer, but ensure that it has a '.csv' file extension.
